Question: 図のような単相3線式回路において、消費電力100W、200Wの2つの負荷はともに抵抗負荷である。図中の印点で断線した場合、a-b間の電圧[V]は。ただし、断線によって負荷の抵抗値は変化しないものとする。
Question_English: In the single-phase three-wire circuit shown in the figure, the two loads with a power consumption of 100 W and 200 W are both resistive loads. What is the voltage [V] between a and b when the wire is broken at the point marked with an x in the figure? However, it is assumed that the resistance value of the load does not change due to disconnection.
Explanation:
The current I flowing through the entire circuit is
I = E/R = 200/150 = 1.333[A]
The voltage between a and b is,
E=IR=1.333...×100
= 133.333...
≒133[V]
Vocab: 断線(だんせん)- Disconnection&負荷(ふか)- Load&回路(かいろ)- Circuit

Explanation:
Thickness Allowable current value
1.6mm 27A
2.0mm 35A
2.6mm 48A
Therefore, 27A x 0.56 = 15.12A.

Question: 使用電圧300V以下の低圧屋内配線の工事方法として、不適切なものは。
Option1: 1 .金属可とう電線管工事で、より線(600Vビニル絶縁電線)を用いて、管内に接続部分を設けないで収めた。
Option2: 2 .ライティングダクト工事で、ダクトの開口部を下に向けて施設した。
Option3: 3 .合成樹脂管工事で、施設する低圧配線と水管が接触していた。
Option4: 4 .金属ダクト工事で、電線を分岐する場合、接続部分に十分な絶縁被覆を施し、かつ、接続部分を容易に点検できるようにしてダクトに収めた。
Question_English: What is inappropriate as a construction method for low-voltage indoor wiring with a working voltage of 300 V or less?
Option1_English: 1. In flexible metal conduit work, stranded wires (600V vinyl insulated wires) were used, and were housed without connecting parts inside the pipe.
Option2_English: 2. In the lighting duct work, the opening of the duct was installed facing downward.
Option3_English: 3. During the synthetic resin pipe work, the low-voltage wiring to be installed was in contact with the water pipe.
Option4_English: 4. When branching electric wires in metal duct construction, the joints were covered with sufficient insulation, and the joints were placed in the duct so that they could be easily inspected.
Ans: Ans: 3. During the synthetic resin pipe work, the low-voltage wiring to be installed was in contact with the water pipe.

Question: アナログ形絶縁抵抗計(電池内蔵)を用いた絶縁抵抗測定に関する記述として、誤っているものは。
Option1: 1 .絶縁抵抗測定の前には、絶縁抵抗計の電池容量が正常であることを確認する。
Option2: 2 .絶縁抵抗測定の前には、絶縁抵抗測定のレンジに切り替え、測定モードにし、接地端子(E:アース)と線路端子(L:ライン)を短絡し零点を指示することを確認する。
Option3: 3 .電子機器が接続された回路の絶縁測定を行う場合は、機器等を損傷させない適正な定格測定電圧を選定する。
Option4: 4 .被測定回路に電源電圧が加わっている状態で測定する。
Question_English: What is wrong about insulation resistance measurement using an analog insulation resistance tester (with built-in battery)?
Option1_English: 1. Before measuring insulation resistance, check that the battery capacity of the insulation resistance meter is normal.
Option2_English: 2. Before the insulation resistance measurement, switch to the insulation resistance measurement range, enter the measurement mode, short the ground terminal (E: ground) and the line terminal (L: line), and confirm that the zero point is indicated.
Option3_English: 3. When measuring the insulation of a circuit to which electronic equipment is connected, select an appropriate rated measurement voltage that will not damage the equipment.
Option4_English: 4. Measure with the power supply voltage applied to the circuit under test.
Ans: Ans: 4. Measure with the power supply voltage applied to the circuit under test.
Vocab: &測定(そくてい)- Measurement​&状態(じょうたい)- State; condition&端子(たんし)- Terminal (electricity)&前に(まえ)-  Before

Question: アナログ計器とディジタル計器の特徴に関する記述として、誤っているものは。
Option1: 1 .アナログ計器は永久磁石可動コイル形計器のように、電磁力等で指針を動かし、触れ角でスケールから値を読み取る。
Option2: 2 .ディジタル計器は測定入力端子に加えられた交流電圧などのアナログ波形を入力変換回路で直流電圧に変換し、次にA-D変換回路に送り、直流電圧この大きさに応じたディジタル量に変換し、測定値が表示される。
Option3: 3 .アナログ計器は変化の度合いを読み取りやすく、測定量を直感的に判断できる利点を持つが、読み取り誤差を生じやすい。
Option4: 4 .電圧測定では、アナログ計器は入力抵抗が高いので被測定回路に影響を与えにくいが、ディジタル計器は入力抵抗が低いので被測定回路に影響を与えやすい。
Question_English: What are the incorrect descriptions of the characteristics of analog and digital instruments?
Option1_English: 1. Analog gauges, like permanent magnet moving coil type gauges, use electromagnetic force to move the pointer and read the value from the scale based on the contact angle.
Option2_English: 2. A digital instrument converts an analog waveform such as an AC voltage applied to a measurement input terminal into a DC voltage in an input conversion circuit, then sends it to an A-D conversion circuit, converts the DC voltage into a digital quantity according to its magnitude, and measures it. value is displayed.
Option3_English: 3. Analog instruments are easy to read the degree of change and have the advantage of being able to intuitively judge the measured quantity, but they are prone to reading errors.
Option4_English: 4. In voltage measurement, an analog meter has a high input resistance and does not easily affect the circuit under test, whereas a digital meter has a low input resistance and thus tends to affect the circuit under test.
Ans: Ans: 4. In voltage measurement, an analog meter has a high input resistance and does not easily affect the circuit under test, whereas a digital meter has a low input resistance and thus tends to affect the circuit under test.
Vocab: 直流(ちょくりゅう)- Direct current​&指針(ししん)- Needle (compass, gauge, etc.)&特徴(とくちょう)- Characteristic&計器(けいき)- Meter; gauge

Question: 「電気工事士法」において、一般用電気工作物に係る工事の作業で、a, bともに電気工事士でなければ従事できないものは。
Option1: 1 .a:配電盤を造営材に取り付ける。  b:電線管を曲げる。
Option2: 2 .a:地中電線用の管を設置する。   b:定格電圧100Vの電力量計を取り付ける。
Option3: 3 .a:電線を支持する柱を設置する。  b:電線管に電線を収める。
Option4: 4 .a:接地極を地面に埋設する。    b:定格電圧125Vの差込み接続器にコードを接続する。
Question_English: According to the "Electrical Construction Professionals Act", for construction work related to general electric facilities, both a and b can only be engaged in by electricians.
Option1_English:
1. a: Attach the switchboard to the construction material. 
b: Bend the conduit.
Option2_English:
2. a: Install pipes for underground cables. 
b: Install a power meter with a rated voltage of 100V.
Option3_English: 3. a: Install poles to support the wires. b: Put the electric wire in the conduit.
Option4_English: 4. a: Bury the ground electrode in the ground.    b: Connect the cord to the plug connector with a rated voltage of 125V.
Ans:
Ans: 1. a: Attach the switchboard to the construction material. 
b: Bend the conduit.
Vocab: &地面(じめん)- Earth's surface&定格(ていかく)- Rated value&従事(じゅうじ)- Engaging in &作業(さぎょう)- Work&作物(さくもつ)- Farm products&電気工(でんきこう)- Electrician

Question: 「電気用品安全法」について述べた記述で、正しいものは。
Option1: 1 .電気工事士は、適法な表示が付されているものでなければ、電気用品を電気工作物の設置等の工事に使用してはならない(経済産業大臣の承認を受けた特定の用途に使用される電気用品を除く)。
Option2: 2 特定電気用品には、(下図のマーク)または(PS)Eの表示が付されている。
Option3: 3 .定格使用電圧100Vの漏電遮断器は特定電気用品以外の電気用品である。
Option4: 4 .電気工作物の部分となり、又はこれに接続して用いられる機械、器具又は、材料はすべて電気用品である。
Question_English: Which of the following statements about the "Electrical Appliance and Material Safety Law" is correct?
Option1_English: 1. Electrical workers shall not use electrical equipment for construction work such as installation of electrical facilities unless legally labeled. (excluding electrical equipment used).
Option2_English: 2. Specified Electrical Appliances and Materials are marked with (mark below) or (PS)E.
Option3_English: 3. Earth leakage breakers with a rated operating voltage of 100V are electrical appliances other than specified electrical appliances.
Option4_English: 4. Any machine, apparatus or material that forms part of or is used in connection with an electrical work piece is an electrical article.
Ans: Ans: 1. Electrical workers shall not use electrical equipment for construction work such as installation of electrical facilities unless legally labeled. (excluding electrical equipment used).
Vocab: &承認(しょうにん)- Recognition&使用(しよう)- Use&表示(ひょうじ)- Indication&記述(きじゅつ)- Description; account

Question: 「電気設備に関する技術基準を定める省令」で定められている交流の電圧区分で、正しいものは。
Option1: 1 .低圧は600V以下、高圧は600Vを超え10000V以下
Option2: 2 .低圧は600V以下、高圧は600Vを超え7000V以下
Option3: 3 .低圧は750V以下、高圧は750Vを超え10000V以下
Option4: 4 .低圧は750V以下、高圧は750Vを超え7000V以下
Question_English: Which is the correct AC voltage category specified in the "Ministerial Ordinance for Establishing Technical Standards for Electrical Equipment"?
Option1_English: 1. Low voltage is 600V or less, high voltage is over 600V and 10000V or less
Option2_English: 2. Low voltage is 600V or less, high voltage is over 600V and 7000V or less
Option3_English: 3. Low voltage is 750V or less, high voltage is over 750V and 10000V or less
Option4_English: 4. Low voltage is 750V or less, high voltage is more than 750V and less than 7000V
Ans: Ans: 2. Low voltage is 600V or less, high voltage is over 600V and 7000V or less
Vocab: 省令(しょうれい)- Ministerial ordinance&高圧(こうあつ)- High voltage&交流(こうりゅう)- Exchange
